Abs.description: Do these exercises in order five times through. Don’t rest between exercises, but pause for 30 seconds after the last move before starting your next round.

exercises.execution:
Grasp and hang from a high bar.

Lift your legs straight to the ceiling and rotate them from side to side.
exercises.name: Windshield Wiper

exercises.execution:
Kneel and hold a barbell on the ground under your shoulders.

Keep your core strong as you roll the bar out in front of you, keeping your arms straight. Return to the starting position.
exercises.name: Barbell Rollout

exercises.execution:
Hold one end of a barbell with the other end anchored.

Tighten your abs as you move the bar in an arc from one side to the other.
exercises.name: Landmine 180

exercises.execution:
Get into a push-up position.

Keep your hips low as your alternate bringing your knees in toward your chest.
exercises.name: Mountain Climbers

Abs.description: This workout includes 4 exercises that will train your entire core. Perform this core workout twice a week, with several days of rest between sessions. AMRAP = As many reps as possible

exercises.execution:
Start in a high plank, with your wrists under shoulders, core engaged, and the top of your feet resting on ball.

Keep hips level and use your core to pull your knees toward your chest, rolling the ball toward you. Straighten your legs and return to the starting position.
exercises.name: Pull In (Stability Ball)

exercises.execution:
Hold a dumbbell in one hand.

Bend your waist to the opposite side of the dumbbell until a slight stretch is felt. Lower to the same distance on the opposite side. Continue by alternating sides.
exercises.name: Dumbell Side Bend

exercises.execution:
Lie down with your knees bent, feet flat on the floor and hands behind your head. Ask a partner or use a weight (barbell, weight plate etc.) to keep your feet fixed.

Lift your upper body until your elbows touch your knees. Slowly return to the starting position.
exercises.name: Sit Up

exercises.execution:
Lie on your back with your knees bent, feet flat on the floor and hands behind your head.

Raise your shoulder blades off the ground, lift your legs off the floor and bend your knees to 90-degree angle. Slowly pedal them in the air, alternating legs as if riding a bicycle.
exercises.name: Air Bike

Abs.description: A short, Intense abdominal workout that will help you build a solid core.

exercises.execution:
Sit on an exercise ball, walk forward, lie back on the ball with your shoulders and head hanging off and knees bent. Gently hyperextend your back on the contour of ball and place hands accross your chest.

Flex waist to raise your upper torso and slowly return to the starting position.
exercises.name: Crunches (Stability Ball)

exercises.execution:
Grasp and hang from a high bar.

Raise your legs by flexing hips and knees until your hips are fully flexed. Continue to raise knees toward shoulders by flexing waist. Return to the starting position with your legs extended.
exercises.name: Hanging Leg Raises

exercises.execution:
Lie on your back with your knees bent, feet flat on the floor and hands behind your head.

Raise your shoulder blades off the ground, lift your legs off the floor and bend your knees to 90-degree angle. Slowly pedal them in the air, alternating legs as if riding a bicycle.
exercises.name: Air Bike

exercises.execution:
Lie down flat and hold your hands behind your neck or folded across your chest. With both legs together, knees and hips bent, position legs to one side of your body.

Flex waist, raising your upper body off the ground. Return to the starting position and repeat the movement in opposite leg position.
exercises.name: Side Crunch

Abs.description: Do these exercises in order three times through. Don’t rest between exercises, but pause for 2 minutes after the last move before starting your next round.

exercises.execution:
Lie down flat and lift your straightened legs from the ground at a 45-degree angle.

As your left foot travels downward and nearly touches the floor, your right foot should seek to reach a 45-degree angle, or as close to one as possible. Bring your right foot down until it nearly touches the floor, and bring your left foot upwards. Your head should stay off the ground, supported by tightened upper abdominals. Continue by alternating legs.
exercises.name: Flutter Kicks

exercises.execution:
Lie down with your knees bent, feet flat on the floor and your arms stretched out straight on each side.

Perform a crunch by reaching both of your arms straight out in front of you. Slowly return to the starting position.
exercises.name: Straight Arm Crunch

exercises.execution:
Sit on the floor, with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground. Lean back so your upper body is at a 45-degree angle to the floor. Keep your back straight at this angle throughout the exercise.

Link your hands together in front of your chest, brace your core and raise your legs up off the ground. Rotate your arms all the way over to one side, then do the same in the opposite direction.
exercises.name: Russian Twist

exercises.execution:
Get into a position on your side and support your body between your forearm and feet.

Hold this position as long as possible. To increase the difficulty, an arm or leg can be raised while performing this exercise.
exercises.name: Side Plank

exercises.execution:
Lie down flat and hold your hands behind your neck or folded across your chest. With both legs together, knees and hips bent, position legs to one side of your body.

Flex waist, raising your upper body off the ground. Return to the starting position and repeat the movement in opposite leg position.
exercises.name: Side Crunch

Abs.description: Do these exercises in order five times through. Don’t rest between exercises, but pause for 60 seconds after the last move before starting your next round.

exercises.execution:
Lie down flat and hold your hands behind your neck.

Lift up with a rolling movement of your back, you should feel each individual vertebrae losing contact with the ground. At the highest point, contract your abs as much as you can and hold there for a second. Return to the starting position by unrolling your back.
exercises.name: Crunches

exercises.execution:
Lie down on your back with hips and knees bent, and hands behind your head.

Twist your waist one direction by raising your torso from the ground, lift one leg toward you and touch your opposite elbow to the rasied leg. Return to the the starting position and repeat with the opposite side.
exercises.name: Cross Body Crunch

exercises.execution:
Lie down with your knees bent, feet flat on the floor and your arms stretched out straight on each side.

Perform a crunch by reaching both of your arms straight out in front of you. Slowly return to the starting position.
exercises.name: Straight Arm Crunch

exercises.execution:
Lie on your back and cross your arms over your chest. Raise your legs off the floor by bending your knees and keeping your calves parallel with the floor.

Raise your torso off the floor while keeping your back on the mat. Slowly return to the starting position.
exercises.name: Tuck Crunch

exercises.execution:
Lie down on the floor with your palms facing down. Bend your hips and knees to a 90-degree angle.

Raise your hips off the floor and crunch them inward. Slowly return to the starting position.
exercises.name: Reverse Crunch

Back.description: This workout is designed to be hard and heavy. Ensure that you take enough time to recover between sets (90-120 seconds). Heavy deadlifts may require an additional minute of rest.

exercises.execution:
With feet flat beneath the bar, squat down to grasp the barbell with a shoulder width, overhand or mixed grip. Take a deep breath and engage your core.

Lift the bar by extending your hips and knees to full extension. Pull your shoulders back at the top of the lift if they are rounded. Lower the bar to the floor by bending your hips back while allowing your knees to bend forward, keeping your back straight and knees pointed in the same direction as your feet.
exercises.name: Barbell Deadlift

exercises.execution:
Grasp the high bar with a shoulder width, underhand grip.

Pull your body up until your elbows are at your sides. Lower your body until your arms and shoulders are fully extended.
exercises.name: Chin Up

exercises.execution:
Bend your knees slightly, bend over and grasp the lever handles while keeping your back straight.

Pull the lever up to your torso. Lower the lever until your arms are extended and shoulders are stretched downward.
exercises.name: T-Bar Row

exercises.execution:
Bend your knees slightly and bend over the bar while keeping your back straight. Grasp the bar in an underhand grip.

Pull the bar to your upper waist. Lower the bar until your arms are extended and shoulders are stretched downward.
exercises.name: Bent Over Barbell Row - Underhand

Back.description: Rather than focusing on size, this workout is designed to enhance the definition and give you a thick back.

exercises.execution:
Bend your knees slightly and bend over the bar while keeping your back straight. Grasp the bar in a wide overhand grip.

Pull the bar to your upper waist. Lower the bar until your arms are extended and shoulders are stretched downward.
exercises.name: Bent Over Barbell Row - Overhand

exercises.execution:
Bend your knees slightly and bend over the bar while keeping your back straight. Grasp the bar in an underhand grip.

Pull the bar to your upper waist. Lower the bar until your arms are extended and shoulders are stretched downward.
exercises.name: Bent Over Barbell Row - Underhand

exercises.execution:
Kneel over the side of the bench by placing your knee and hand of the supporting arm on the bench. Position your opposite foot slightly back and to the side. Grasp the dumbbell from floor.

Pull the dumbbell up until it makes contact with ribs or until your upper arm is just beyond horizontal. Lower the dumbbell until your arm is extended and your shoulder is stretched downward.
exercises.name: Bent Over Row - Dumbbell

exercises.execution:
With feet flat beneath the bar, squat down to grasp the barbell with a shoulder width, overhand or mixed grip. Take a deep breath and engage your core.

Lift the bar by extending your hips and knees to full extension. Pull your shoulders back at the top of the lift if they are rounded. Lower the bar to the floor by bending your hips back while allowing your knees to bend forward, keeping your back straight and knees pointed in the same direction as your feet.
exercises.name: Barbell Deadlift

Back.description: This workout focuses on developing a wide V-taper by working the upper back. For all the movements in this workout routine, position your hands just slightly wider than your shoulders on each side. For the seconds round of Lateral Pulldowns (Ex. 4), use a weight that causes you to fail at 10 reps.

exercises.execution:
Grasp the high cable bar with a wide overhand grip and sit with your thighs under the supports.

Pull the bar down to your upper chest. Return the bar until your arms and shoulders are fully extended.
exercises.name: Lateral Pulldown - Wide Grip

exercises.execution:
Bend your knees slightly, bend over and grasp the lever handles while keeping your back straight.

Pull the lever up to your torso. Lower the lever until your arms are extended and shoulders are stretched downward.
exercises.name: T-Bar Row

exercises.execution:
Sit slightly forward on the seat and grasp the cable attachment. Place your feet on vertical platform and slide your hips back, positioning your knees with slight bend.

Pull the cable attachment to your waist while straightening lower back. Pull your shoulders back and push your chest forward while creating a slight arch in your back. Return until your arms are extended, shoulders are stretched forward, and your lower back is flexed forward slightly.
exercises.name: Seated Cable Rows

exercises.execution:
Grasp the high cable bar with a wide overhand grip and sit with your thighs under the supports.

Pull the bar down to your upper chest. Return the bar until your arms and shoulders are fully extended.
exercises.name: Lateral Pulldown - Wide Grip

Back.description: This workout is designed to add definition and details to your back by using higher reps and supersets. Throughout this workout, ensure that you focus on squeezing the muscles and feeling them contract and stretch. Super set Straight Arm Pulldowns (Ex. 3) with the Single Arm - High Cable Rows (Ex. 4).

exercises.execution:
Grasp the high cable bar with a close overhand grip and sit with your thighs under the supports.

Pull the bar down to your upper chest. Return the bar until your arms and shoulders are fully extended.
exercises.name: Lateral Pulldown - Close Grip

exercises.execution:
Sit slightly forward on the seat and grasp the cable attachment. Place your feet on vertical platform and slide your hips back, positioning your knees with slight bend.

Pull the cable attachment to your waist while straightening lower back. Pull your shoulders back and push your chest forward while creating a slight arch in your back. Return until your arms are extended, shoulders are stretched forward, and your lower back is flexed forward slightly.
exercises.name: Seated Cable Rows

exercises.execution:
Grasp the bar from the high pulley using a shoulder width overhand grip. Bend your torso forward at the waist by around 30-degrees with your arms fully extended in front of you and a slight bend at the elbows.

While keeping the arms straight, pull the bar down by contracting the lats until your hands are next to the side of the thighs. Return until you feel a stretch in your lats.
exercises.name: Straight Arm Pulldown

exercises.execution:
Grasp the cable in an overhand grip and kneel down on the floor.

Pull and rotate the cable attachment down to the side of your chest so that you are in an underhand grip at the bottom of the movement. Return until your arm and shoulder is fully extended, and you are back in an overhand grip.
exercises.name: Single Arm - High Cable Row

exercises.execution:
Grasp the high cable bar with a wide overhand grip and sit with your thighs under the supports.

Pull the bar down behind your neck. Return the bar until your arms and shoulders are fully extended.
exercises.name: Rear Lateral Pulldown - Wide Grip

exercises.execution:
Lie face down on a hyperextension bench, tucking your ankles securely under the footpads and cross your arms in front of you.

Bend forward slowly at the waist as far as you can while keeping your back flat. Slowly return to the starting position.
exercises.name: 45-Degree Hyperextensions

Back.description: This is a lower-back friendly workout for those of you have injuries/issues in your lower back. The workout is designed to allow you to develop your back without putting any strain on the lower back. The key to keeping this workout safe is to stay on the support pads on all movements.

exercises.execution:
Grasp the high cable bar with a wide overhand grip and sit with your thighs under the supports.

Pull the bar down to your upper chest. Return the bar until your arms and shoulders are fully extended.
exercises.name: Lateral Pulldown - Wide Grip

exercises.execution:
Bend your knees slightly and rest your chest on the support pad. Grasp the lever handles with a shoulder width underhand grip.

Pull the lever up to your torso. Lower the lever until your arms are extended and shoulders are stretched downward.
exercises.name: Reverse T-Bar Row

exercises.execution:
Grasp the high cable bar with a close overhand grip and sit with your thighs under the supports.

Pull the bar down to your upper chest. Return the bar until your arms and shoulders are fully extended.
exercises.name: Lateral Pulldown - Close Grip

exercises.execution:
Sit down and place your chest against the support pad. Grasp the lever handles with an underhand grip.

Pull the levers back until your elbows are just behind your back with shoulders pulled back. Return until your arms are extended and shoulders are stretched forward.
exercises.name: Seated Row

exercises.execution:
Lie down on an elevated, angled bench, and grasp dumbbells below to either side.

Pull the dumbbells to sides until your upper arm is just beyond horizontal or at the height of your back. Lower the dumbbells until your arms are extended and shoulders are stretched downward.
exercises.name: Incline Row - Dumbbell

Chest.description: This workout is about hypertrophy, not power and strength. It implements higher reps on the inner-chest exercises and more total volume to deliver a good pump.

exercises.execution:
Lie flat on bench and support dumbbells above your chest with arms fixed and slightly bent. Internally rotate shoulders so your elbows point out to the sides.

Lower dumbbells to the sides until your chest is stretched, while maintaining the slight bend in your elbows. Bring the dumbbells together in wide hugging motion until they are nearly together directly above your chest.
exercises.name: Dumbbell Fly

exercises.execution:
Lie flat on bench. Dismount barbell from the rack over your upper chest using a wide oblique, overhand grip.

Lower the bar to your chest and press bar upward until your arms are extended.
exercises.name: Bench Press

exercises.execution:
Grasp two opposing high pulley cables and stand with the pulleys to either side. Bend over slightly by flexing hips and knees, bend your elbows slightly and internally rotate shoulders so that your elbows are back initially.

Bring the cable handles together in hugging motion with elbows in fixed position. Keep your shoulders internally rotated so that your elbows are pointed upward at the top of the motion, and out to the sides at the bottom of the movement. Return to starting position until your chest muscles are stretched.
exercises.name: Cable Fly

exercises.execution:
Lie down with your hands placed on top of the bosu ball, and raise your body off floor by extending arms and keeping your body straight.

Lower body by bending your arms, until your chest is just above the floor. Push your body up until arms are extended.
exercises.name: Push Up (Bosu Ball)

Chest.description: Go heavy on the first exercise, and then pump the muscles full of blood with lighter weights and higher reps for the remaining exercises

exercises.execution:
Lie supine on an incline bench. Dismount barbell from the rack over your upper chest using a wide oblique, overhand grip.

Lower the bar to your chest and press the bar upward until your arms are extended.
exercises.name: Incline Bench Press

exercises.execution:
Sit down on bench with dumbbells resting on lower thigh. Kick the dumbbells to your shoulders and lie back. Position the dumbbells to the sides of your chest with bent arm under each dumbbell.

Press dumbbells over your chest and lockout. Lower dumbbells until a slight stretch is felt in your chest or shoulders.
exercises.name: Dumbbell Bench Press

exercises.execution:
Sit with your back against the pad, and grasp the handles on both sides at shoulder height. Slightly bend elbows and internally rotate shoulders so your elbows are back.

Keeping elbows pointed high, push the lever handles forward and together. Slowly return to the starting position until a mild stretch is felt in your chest or shoulders.
exercises.name: Machine Seated Fly

Chest.description: Keep all the work/weight relatively light, with a focus on experimenting with intensity techniques that work the chest to exhaustion. Perform the exercises in sequence with no rest in between. Rest for up to two minutes between rounds and repeat for a total of 3 rounds.

exercises.execution:
Sit with your chest approximately at the height of the handles. Grasp handles with wide overhand grip and elbows out to the sides, just below your shoulders.

Push levers until your arms are fully extended. Slowly return to the starting position until a mild stretch is felt in your chest.
exercises.name: Machine Chest Press

exercises.execution:
Lie with your upper back perpendicular to the bench. Flex hips slightly and grasp one dumbbell with both hands under the inner plate of the dumbbell. Position the dumbbell over your chest with elbows slightly bent.

Keeping elbows slightly bent throughout movement, lower the dumbbell over and beyond your head until upper arms are in-line with your torso. Pull the dumbbell up and over your chest.
exercises.name: Dumbbell Pullover

exercises.execution:
Lie flat on bench and support dumbbells above your chest with arms fixed and slightly bent. Internally rotate shoulders so your elbows point out to the sides.

Lower dumbbells to the sides until your chest is stretched, while maintaining the slight bend in your elbows. Bring the dumbbells together in wide hugging motion until they are nearly together directly above your chest.
exercises.name: Dumbbell Fly

Chest.description: Choose weights that allow you to just complete the number of reps listed. Over time, work up to increasing the weight while completing the number of reps listed for every set. For best results, perform this workout twice a week with a sufficient number of rest days inbetween.

exercises.execution:
Sit down on bench with dumbbells resting on lower thigh. Kick the dumbbells to your shoulders and lie back. Position the dumbbells to the sides of your chest with bent arm under each dumbbell.

Press dumbbells over your chest and lockout. Lower dumbbells until a slight stretch is felt in your chest or shoulders.
exercises.name: Incline Dumbbell Press

exercises.execution:
Lie flat on bench and support dumbbells above your chest with arms fixed and slightly bent. Internally rotate shoulders so your elbows point out to the sides.

Lower dumbbells to the sides until your chest is stretched, while maintaining the slight bend in your elbows. Bring the dumbbells together in wide hugging motion until they are nearly together directly above your chest.
exercises.name: Dumbbell Fly

exercises.execution:
Lie down with your hands placed on top of the bosu ball, and raise your body off floor by extending arms and keeping your body straight.

Lower body by bending your arms, until your chest is just above the floor. Push your body up until arms are extended.
exercises.name: Push Up (Bosu Ball)

Chest.description: Use a heavy weight on the decline bench press, and progressively lighter weights as the workout goes on and fatigue sets in. Finish with two sets of pushups, which should feel very difficult after the other exercises.

exercises.execution:
Lie flat on a decline bench with feet under the brace. Dismount barbell from the rack over your upper chest using a wide oblique, overhand grip.

Lower the bar to your chest and press bar upward until your arms are extended.
exercises.name: Decline Bench Press

exercises.execution:
Lie supine on bench and support dumbbells above your chest with arms fixed and slightly bent. Internally rotate shoulders so your elbows point out to the sides.

Lower dumbbells to the sides until your chest is stretched, while maintaining the slight bend in your elbows. Bring the dumbbells together in wide hugging motion until they are nearly together directly above your chest.
exercises.name: Incline Dumbbell Fly

exercises.execution:
Sit down on bench with dumbbells resting on lower thigh. Kick the dumbbells to your shoulders and lie back. Position the dumbbells to the sides of your chest with bent arm under each dumbbell. Twist the dumbbells so that your palms are facing your shoulders.

Press dumbbells over your chest and lockout. Lower dumbbells until a slight stretch is felt in your chest or shoulders.
exercises.name: Dumbbell Reverse Bench Press

exercises.execution:
Lie down with your hands slightly wider than shoulder width apart, and raise your body off floor by extending arms and keeping your body straight.

Lower body by bending your arms, until your chest is just above the floor. Push your body up until arms are extended.
exercises.name: Push Up

Shoulders.description: This basic routine consists of an overhead press plus a single-joint move for each of the three delt heads. Where possible, start with machines to learn the feel of the motion before graduating to free weights. Start light to focus on proper form first. Add weight only when you can fully control the motion.

exercises.execution:
Sit and grasp the lever handles to each side with an overhand grip.

Press the lever until your arms are extended upward. Slowly return to the starting position.
exercises.name: Lever Military Press

exercises.execution:
Grasp dumbbells in front of your thighs with elbows slightly bent. Bend forward with a slight bend in your hips and knees.

Raise your upper arms to the sides, until your elbows are shoulder height. Ensure your elbows' height is above or equal to your wrists. Slowly return to the starting position.
exercises.name: Side Lateral Raise

exercises.execution:
Stand facing the pulleys and grasp stirrups with arms straight down to each side of your body with palms facing back.

Raise the stirrups forward and upward until your upper arms are well above horizontal. Slowly return to the starting position.
exercises.name: Front Cable Raise

exercises.execution:
Sit on the machine with your chest against the pad. Grasp the parallel handles with your thumbs up at shoulder height. Bend elbows slightly and internally rotate your shoulders so that your elbows are at shoulder height.

Keeping elbows pointed high, pull the handles apart and to the rear until your elbows are just behind your back. Slowly return to the starting position.
exercises.name: Reverse Machine Fly

Shoulders.description: This is a short, sharp 30 minute workout that is intended to train your shoulders extremely hard. This workout must be executed with focus and intensity from start to finish. The third set of the Seated Dumbbell Press (Ex. 2) is for AMRAP. The Front plate raise (Ex. 3) and Seated Side Lateral Raise (Ex. 4) are to be performed as a superset.

exercises.execution:
Stand facing the twin pulley cables positioned close together and at shoulder height. Grasp the cable attachment in each hand, step back away from machine to allow for tension in the cable and stand with feet staggered. Point your elbows outward with your arms straight or slightly bent.

Pull the stirrups out to your sides, maintaining a strong elbow position throughout exercise. Slowly return to the starting position.
exercises.name: Cable Rear Delt Fly

exercises.execution:
Sit down on the seat with dumbbells resting on lower thigh. Kick the dumbbells up and position them to each side of your shoulders with elbows below wrists.

Press dumbbells upward until arms are extended overhead. Lower to the sides of your shoulders and repeat.
exercises.name: Seated Dumbbell Press

exercises.execution:
Grasp a weight plate with your elbows straight or slightly bent.

Raise the plate forward and upward until your upper arms are above horizontal. Slowly return to the starting position.
exercises.name: Front Plate Raise

exercises.execution:
Sit down on the seat with dumbbells to either side and elbows slightly bent.

Raise your upper arms to the sides until your elbow is at shoulder height. Slowly return to the starting position.
exercises.name: Seated Lateral Raise

exercises.execution:
Grasp the bar in a shoulder width grip or slightly narrow overhand grip.

Pull the bar up to your neck with elbows leading and allow your wrists to flex as the bar rises. Slowly return to the starting position.
exercises.name: Upright Barbell Row

Shoulders.description: The deltoid is divided into 3 main parts; The anterior (front deltoid), lateral (middle deltoid), and posterior head (rear deltoid). This workout emphasises the workload on the anterior head (front deltoid), by incorporating two press exercises that allow for multi-joint movements, followed by two single-joint movements that specifically target the anterior head. The pressing movements should be performed using moderate to heavy weights. The One-Arm Side Laterals (Ex. 4) puts a focus on the middle delts to allow for a balanced workout.

exercises.execution:
Sit down on the seat, grasp the barbell with a slightly wider than shoulder width overhand grip and position the bar near your upper chest.

Press the bar upward until your arms are extended overhead. Slowly return to the starting position.
exercises.name: Seated Barbell Military Press

exercises.execution:
Sit down on seat with two dumbbells positioned in front of your shoulders, palms facing your body and elbows under wrists.

Initiate the movement by bringing elbows out to your sides. Continue to raise your elbows outward while pressing dumbbells overhead until your arms are straight. Slowly return to the starting position by reversing the movement.
exercises.name: Arnold Dumbbell Press

exercises.execution:
Stand facing the pulleys and grasp stirrups with arms straight down to each side of your body with palms facing back.

Raise the stirrups forward and upward until your upper arms are well above horizontal. Slowly return to the starting position.
exercises.name: Front Cable Raise

exercises.execution:
Position a dumbbell in front of your pelvis with elbows slightly bent. Grasp a stationary object with other hand to provide support. Bend over with a slight bend in your knees.

Raise your upper arm to the side until your elbow is at shoulder height. Maintain a perpendicular motion with your upper arm, a fixed elbow position and ensure elbows are above your wrists throughout the exercise. Slowly return to the starting position.
exercises.name: One-Arm Side Laterals

Shoulders.description: The deltoid is divided into 3 main parts; The anterior (front deltoid), lateral (middle deltoid), and posterior head (rear deltoid). This workout emphasises the workload on the lateral head (middle deltoid), by incorporating two multi-joint exercises, followed by two single-joint movements that specifically target the lateral head. The Reverse Machine Fly (Ex. 4) puts a focus on the rear delts to allow for a balanced workout. Perform AMRAP for the last set of your Machine Lateral Raise (Ex 3).

exercises.execution:
Sit down on the seat with dumbbells resting on lower thigh. Kick the dumbbells up and position them to each side of your shoulders with elbows below wrists.

Press dumbbells upward until arms are extended overhead. Lower to the sides of your shoulders and repeat.
exercises.name: Seated Dumbbell Press

exercises.execution:
Grasp the bar in a shoulder width grip or slightly narrow overhand grip.

Pull the bar up to your neck with elbows leading and allow your wrists to flex as the bar rises. Slowly return to the starting position.
exercises.name: Upright Barbell Row

exercises.execution:
Sit down on seat and position bent arms between the padded lever and sides of your body.

Raise arms to the sides until your upper arms are horizontal. Slowly return to the starting position.
exercises.name: Machine Lateral Raise

exercises.execution:
Sit on the machine with your chest against the pad. Grasp the parallel handles with your thumbs up at shoulder height. Bend elbows slightly and internally rotate your shoulders so that your elbows are at shoulder height.

Keeping elbows pointed high, pull the handles apart and to the rear until your elbows are just behind your back. Slowly return to the starting position.
exercises.name: Reverse Machine Fly

Shoulders.description: The deltoid is divided into 3 main parts; The anterior (front deltoid), lateral (middle deltoid), and posterior head (rear deltoid). This workout emphasises the workload on the posterior head (rear deltoid), by incorporating a row that allows for a multi-joint movement, followed by three single-joint movements that specifically target the posterior head.

exercises.execution:
Bend your knees slightly, bend over and grasp the lever handles while keeping your back straight.

Pull the lever up to your torso. Lower the lever until your arms are extended and shoulders are stretched downward.
exercises.name: T-Bar Row

exercises.execution:
Sit on the edge of a bench, bend over and position your torso over thighs. Grasp dumbbells with each hand under your legs. Position elbows with slight bend with palms facing together behind your ankles.

Raise your upper arms to sides until your elbows are at shoulder height. Maintain a perpendicular motion with your upper arms, a fixed elbow position and ensure elbows are above your wrists throughout the exercise.
exercises.name: Seated Rear Deltoid Raise

exercises.execution:
Stand with your side to a low pulley and grasp the stirrup attachment with your hand that is furthest from pulley.

Raise your upper arms to the sides until your elbow is at shoulder height. Slowly return to the starting position.
exercises.name: Cable Lateral Raise

exercises.execution:
Stand facing the twin pulley cables positioned close together and at shoulder height. Grasp the cable attachment in each hand, step back away from machine to allow for tension in the cable and stand with feet staggered. Point your elbows outward with your arms straight or slightly bent.

Pull the stirrups out to your sides, maintaining a strong elbow position throughout exercise. Slowly return to the starting position.
exercises.name: Cable Rear Delt Fly

Arms.description: This is a high intensity workout with a total focus on the biceps. It consists of four exercises that provide the greatest stimulus across both the long and the short bicep heads.

exercises.execution:
Hold barbell with shoulder width underhand grip.

With elbows to your sides, raise the bar until your forearms are vertical. Lower until arms are fully extended.
exercises.name: Barbell Curls

exercises.execution:
Hold a dumbbell and sit on the preacher bench. With your arm bent and palm facing shoulder, place the back of your arm down on the pad.

Lower the dumbbell until your arm is fully extended. Raise the dumbbell until your forearm is vertical.
exercises.name: One-Arm Preacher Curls

exercises.execution:
Sit back on a 45-60 degree incline bench. With your arms hanging down straight, position the two dumbbells with your palms facing inward.

With your elbows back to the sides, raise one dumbbell and rotate your forearm until it is vertical and your palm is facing your shoulder. Lower your arm to the original position and repeat with opposite arm. Alternate arms with every repetition.
exercises.name: Incline Dumbbell Curls

exercises.execution:
Hold a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing in and arms straight.

With your elbows to your sides, raise one dumbbell until your forearm is vertical. Lower your arm to original position and repeat with opposite arm. Alternate arms with every repetition.
exercises.name: Hammer Curls

Arms.description: This workout includes a combination of exercises designed to work your long-head and lateral head. For all tricep exercises, keep your elbows as tight to your sides as you can.

exercises.execution:
Lie flat on bench and grasp barbell from the rack in a shoulder width grip.

Lower the weight to your chest with elbows close to your body and push the barbell back up until your arms are straight.
exercises.name: Close-Grip Barbell Bench Press

exercises.execution:
Place handles in the narrow position. Sit on the seat with your back against pad. Grasp the handles and position your elbows back.

Push the levers down by straightening your arms downward. Allow the lever bar to raise with your elbows pointing back, until your shoulders are slightly stretched.
exercises.name: Dip Machine

exercises.execution:
Sit down on the seat with dumbbells resting on lower thigh. Kick the dumbbells up and position them to each side of your shoulders with elbows below wrists.

Press dumbbells upward until arms are extended overhead. Lower to the sides of your shoulders and repeat.
exercises.name: Seated Dumbbell Press

exercises.execution:
Face the high pulley, grasp the V-bar attachment with a narrow overhand grip and position your elbows to the side

Extend arms down and return until your forearm is close to your upper arm.
exercises.name: Triceps Pushdown - V Bar

Arms.description: The exercises in the following workout target the two heads of the bicep, the long head and the short head, as well as the brachialis.

exercises.execution:
Step up and grasp the bar with an underhand shoulder width grip.

Pull your body up until elbows are to your sides. Lower your body until your arms and shoulders are fully extended.
exercises.name: Chin-ups

exercises.execution:
Sit back on a 45-60 degree incline bench. With your arms hanging down straight, position the two dumbbells with your palms facing inward.

With your elbows back to the sides, raise one dumbbell and rotate your forearm until it is vertical and your palm is facing your shoulder. Lower your arm to the original position and repeat with opposite arm. Alternate arms with every repetition.
exercises.name: Incline Dumbbell Curls

exercises.execution:
Sit on a bench and hold a dumbbell between your feet. Place the back of your upper arm against your inner thigh. Lean into the leg to raise your elbow slightly.

Raise the dumbbell to your front of shoulder. Lower the dumbbell until your arm is fully extended.
exercises.name: Concentration Curls

exercises.execution:
Hold an EZ-Bar in an overhand shoulder width grip.

With elbows to your sides, raise the bar until your forearms are vertical. Lower until arms are fully extended.
exercises.name: Reverse EZ Bar Curls

Arms.description: This workout starts with a multijoint exercise for an initial size and strength stimulus, then increases the intensity by adding high volumes of work. Superset EZ-Bar Skullcrushers (Ex. 2) with the Close-Grip Barbell Bench Press (Ex. 3) and superset Triceps Pushdown - Rope (Ex. 4) with Triceps Overhead Extention - Rope (Ex. 5).

exercises.execution:
Place handles in the narrow position. Sit on the seat with your back against pad. Grasp the handles and position your elbows back.

Push the levers down by straightening your arms downward. Allow the lever bar to raise with your elbows pointing back, until your shoulders are slightly stretched.
exercises.name: Dip Machine

exercises.execution:
Lie on the bench with a narrow overhand grip on the barbell. Position the barbell over your shoulders with arms extended.

Lower the bar to your forehead by bending your elbows. Extend your arms and repeat.
exercises.name: EZ-Bar Skullcrusher

exercises.execution:
Lie flat on bench and grasp barbell from the rack in a shoulder width grip.

Lower the weight to your chest with elbows close to your body and push the barbell back up until your arms are straight.
exercises.name: Close-Grip Barbell Bench Press

exercises.execution:
Face the high pulley, grasp the rope attachment with a narrow overhand grip and position your elbows to the side

Extend arms down and turn your palms down at the bottom. Return until your forearm is close to your upper arm.
exercises.name: Triceps Pushdown - Rope

exercises.execution:
From high pulley cable, grasp the ends of the rope attachment. Raise one arm over head while turning your body away from the pulley. Face away from the pulley with feet staggered. Position ends of the ropes behind your head or neck with elbows upward and over head.

Raise ends of the rope overhead by extending forearms until your arms are straight. Lower the rope attachment until your forearms are against your upper arms.
exercises.name: Triceps Overhead Extension - Rope

Arms.description: This workout is designed to shock your muscles in a way that is different to the standard routine of training arms. This intense workout should be executed once month to compliment your usual bicep/tricep workouts.

exercises.execution:
Sit with two dumbbells position in front of shoulders, palms facing your body and elbows under wrists.

Initiate the movement by bringing elbows out to sides. Continue to raise your elbows outward while pressing dumbbells overhead until your arms are straight. Lower to the front of your shoulders in the opposite pattern and repeat.
exercises.name: Seated Dumbbell Curl

exercises.execution:
Sit on the preacher bench placing back of your arms on the pad. Grasp the bar in a shoulder width, underhand grip.

Raise the bar until your forearms are vertical. Lower barbell until your arms are fully extended.
exercises.name: Preacher Curls

exercises.execution:
Hold barbell with shoulder width underhand grip.

With elbows to your sides, raise the bar until your forearms are vertical. Lower until arms are fully extended.
exercises.name: Barbell Curls

exercises.execution:
Lie flat on bench and grasp barbell from the rack in a shoulder width grip.

Lower the weight to your chest with elbows close to your body and push the barbell back up until your arms are straight.
exercises.name: Close-Grip Barbell Bench Press

exercises.execution:
Position a dumbbell over your head with both hands under the inner plate (heart shaped grip).

With elbows over your head, lower forearms behind your upper arms by flexing your elbows. Flex your wrists at bottom to avoid hitting dumbbell on back of your neck. Raise the dumbbell over head by extending your elbows while hyper-extending your wrists.
exercises.name: Standing Dumbbell Triceps Extensions

exercises.execution:
Face the high pulley, grasp the V-bar attachment with a narrow overhand grip and position your elbows to the side

Extend arms down and return until your forearm is close to your upper arm.
exercises.name: Triceps Pushdown - V Bar

Legs.description: This workout targets the major muscle groups in your legs: quads, glutes, hamstrings, and calves. It starts with the most challenging exercises and heaviest loads, while the rest of the workout hits the thighs from a range of angles.

exercises.execution:
Rest the bar on the back of your shoulders, grasp the barbell on either side and stand with your feet shoulder width apart.

Squat down by bending hips back while allowing your knees to bend forward, keeping your back straight and knees pointed in the same direction as your feet. Descend until your thighs are slightly past parallel to floor. Extend your knees and hips until legs are straight.
exercises.name: Barbell Squat

exercises.execution:
Sit down with your back against the back support and place your feet on the platform. Grasp the handles, extend your hips and knees and release lever.

Lower the platform by flexing your hips and knees until your hips are completely flexed. Slowly return to the starting position.
exercises.name: Leg Press

exercises.execution:
Stand while holding dumbbells on either side.

Step forward with your first leg. Land heel first, followed by the forefoot. Lower your body by flexing the knee and hip of your front leg until the knee of your rear leg is almost in contact with floor. Stand on the front leg with assistance of the rear leg and lunge forward with opposite leg. Alternate legs with every lunge.
exercises.name: Walking Lunges - Dumbbell

exercises.execution:
Sit down with your back against the back support and place your shins under the padded lever. Grasp the handles to sides for support.

Move the lever forward and upward by extending knees until your legs are straight. Slowly return to the starting position.
exercises.name: Leg Extensions

exercises.execution:
Grasp dumbells in front of you and stand with your feet shoulder width apart.

Flex your hips and drive your glutes back as far as you can, which should generate tension in your hamstrings as your hands approach knee level. Lift dumbbells by extending hips and waist until standing upright. Pull shoulders back slightly if rounded.
exercises.name: Romanian Deadlift - Dumbbell

exercises.execution:
Lie prone on the bench with your knees just beyond the edge of the bench. Lower your legs under the pads and grasp the handles.

Raise the pad to the back of your thighs by flexing your knees. Slowly return to the starting position.
exercises.name: Hamstring Curls

exercises.execution:
Position your toes and balls of your feet on a calf block with your heels extending off. Place your hand on a support for balance.

Raise your heels by extending ankles as high as possible. Lower your heels by bending ankles until your calves are stretched.
exercises.name: Standing Calf Raises

Legs.description: This workout is largely machine based, which allows you to practice movements before loading them with heavier weights or moving on to more complex/challenging free-weight moves.

exercises.execution:
Hold a kettlebell close to your chest with your elbows pointing down and feet hip width apart.

Squat down by bending hips back while allowing your knees to bend forward, keeping your back straight and knees pointed in the same direction as your feet. Descend until your elbows contact your knees. Extend your knees and hips until legs are straight.
exercises.name: Goblet Squat

exercises.execution:
Sit down with your back against the back support and place your feet on the platform. Grasp the handles, extend your hips and knees and release lever.

Lower the platform by flexing your hips and knees until your hips are completely flexed. Slowly return to the starting position.
exercises.name: Leg Press

exercises.execution:
Sit down with your back against the back support and place your shins under the padded lever. Grasp the handles to sides for support.

Move the lever forward and upward by extending knees until your legs are straight. Slowly return to the starting position.
exercises.name: Leg Extensions

exercises.execution:
Sit down with your back against the back support and place your legs in between the pads. Release the hand lever and grasp the handles.

Pull the lever to the back of your thighs by flexing knees. Slowly return to the starting position.
exercises.name: Seated Leg Curl

exercises.execution:
Position your toes and balls of your feet on a calf block with your heels extending off. Place your hand on a support for balance.

Raise your heels by extending ankles as high as possible. Lower your heels by bending ankles until your calves are stretched.
exercises.name: Standing Calf Raises

Legs.description: This workout is focused on building your quads. The key exercise in this workout to get your quads firing is the front squat, which emphasises the quads more than a back squat by shifting your center of gravity forward.

exercises.execution:
Rest the bar on the front of your shoulders, cross your arms, place hands on top of barbell ensuring that your arms parallel to floor.

Squat down by bending hips back while allowing your knees to bend forward, keeping your back straight and knees pointed in the same direction as your feet. Descend until your thighs are slightly past parallel to floor. Extend your knees and hips until legs are straight.
exercises.name: Front Barbell Squat

exercises.execution:
Lie against the back pad with your shoulders under the shoulder pad and place your feet on the platform. Extend your hips and knees and release lever.

Squat down by flexing your hips and knees until your thighs are slightly past parallel to floor. Extend your knees and hips until legs are straight.
exercises.name: Hack Squat

exercises.execution:
Sit down with your back against the back support and place your feet on the platform. Grasp the handles, extend your hips and knees and release lever.

Lower the platform by flexing your hips and knees until your hips are completely flexed. Slowly return to the starting position.
exercises.name: Leg Press

exercises.execution:
Sit down with your back against the back support and place your shins under the padded lever. Grasp the handles to sides for support.

Move the lever forward and upward by extending knees until your legs are straight. Slowly return to the starting position.
exercises.name: Leg Extensions

Legs.description: This workout is focused on building your glutes. The following exercises allow the glutes to be trained through their full range of motion. Ensure you achieve a good depth in all squatting motions to maximise glute activation.

exercises.execution:
Rest the bar on the back of your shoulders, grasp the barbell on either side and stand with your feet wide by pointing them outward in a 30 to 45-degree angle.

Squat down by bending hips back while allowing your knees to bend forward, keeping your back straight and knees pointed in the same direction as your feet. Descend until your thighs are slightly past parallel to floor. Extend your knees and hips until legs are straight.
exercises.name: Barbell Squat - Wide Stance

exercises.execution:
Sit down with your back against the back support and place your feet on the platform. Grasp the handles, extend your hips and knees and release lever.

Lower the platform by flexing your hips and knees until your hips are completely flexed. Slowly return to the starting position.
exercises.name: Leg Press

exercises.execution:
Rest the bar on the back of your shoulders and grasp the barbell on either side.

Lunge forward with your first leg. Land heel first, followed by the forefoot. Lower your body by flexing the knee and hip of your front leg until the knee of your rear leg is almost in contact with floor. Return to the starting position and alternate legs.
exercises.name: Barbell Lunge

exercises.execution:
Grasp dumbells in front of you and stand with your feet shoulder width apart.

Flex your hips and drive your glutes back as far as you can, which should generate tension in your hamstrings as your hands approach knee level. Lift dumbbells by extending hips and waist until standing upright. Pull shoulders back slightly if rounded.
exercises.name: Romanian Deadlift - Dumbbell

Legs.description: This workout is focused on building your hamstrings. Sumo deadlifts are an effective move to build your hamstrings, but good form is critical with any type of deadlifts. Keep your back flat and ensure that the range of motion does not cause your back to round.

exercises.execution:
Position your feet in a wide stance, bend at the hips, keep your chest up, drive your hips back and reach down to grasp the barbell with a shoulder width overhand or mixed grip. Take a deep breath and engage your core.

Keep your spine straight as you squeeze your glutes, thrust your hips forward and raise the barbell as you straighten your legs to stand. Slowly return to the starting position.
exercises.name: Sumo Deadlift

exercises.execution:
Mount the machine by supporting one knee on the horizontal pad and placing the other leg under the roller pad, with your quad against the vertical pad. Grasp the handles and rest your forearms on padded arm rest.

Raise your ankle to the back of your thigh by flexing your knee. Slowly return to the starting position and alternate legs between sets.
exercises.name: Kneeling Leg Curl

exercises.execution:
Grasp dumbells in front of you and stand with your feet shoulder width apart.

Flex your hips and drive your glutes back as far as you can, which should generate tension in your hamstrings as your hands approach knee level. Lift dumbbells by extending hips and waist until standing upright. Pull shoulders back slightly if rounded.
exercises.name: Romanian Deadlift - Dumbbell
